projects.title: Build a School
projects.description: In a remote rural region of Tigray, Ethiopia, access to education for girls has historically been extremely limited due to both infrastructure challenges and cultural barriers. This project aimed to construct a safe and fully equipped primary school to serve 120 young girls, providing them with not just classrooms but also access to clean water, hygiene facilities, and a small library. By empowering young girls through education, the initiative hopes to break cycles of poverty, promote gender equality, and create opportunities for future community leadership. Local materials and labor were used in the construction process to ensure community ownership and sustainability.

projects.title: Clean Water Wells Initiative
projects.description: Barisal is a low-lying region in Bangladesh frequently affected by flooding and waterborne diseases. Many rural communities here rely on contaminated surface water for daily needs. This project involves the drilling of five deep-tube clean water wells equipped with hand pumps, which will serve over 2,000 people. The initiative includes community-led training on water sanitation and maintenance, empowering locals to keep the system functional long-term. Special attention is being given to schools and maternal care centers to reduce health risks among children and pregnant women.

projects.title: Train New Local Teachers
projects.description: With a significant portion of the population under 18, Uganda faces a severe shortage of qualified teachers in rural areas. This project provided scholarships and teacher training certification programs for 20 aspiring educators from underprivileged communities. The curriculum focused on child-centered pedagogy, inclusive classroom strategies, and technology-assisted teaching. Graduates have now been deployed to remote schools where they are not only teaching but also mentoring others, significantly raising the standard of education in those regions.

projects.title: Health Clinic for Mothers
projects.description: High in the Andean region of Cusco, access to maternal healthcare remains limited. This project is establishing a small but fully functional maternal and child health clinic offering prenatal checkups, vaccinations, and nutritional counseling. The facility also serves as a hub for mobile outreach to surrounding villages. Beyond providing medical services, the project includes training for local women as community health advocates, increasing awareness about family planning, early childhood nutrition, and hygiene. The initiative has already fostered strong community participation and trust.

projects.title: Support Orphan Education
projects.description: In the aftermath of recent natural disasters, many children in Port-au-Prince were left without families or access to formal education. This initiative provided school materials, uniforms, emotional support, and tutoring to over 75 orphans. The project partnered with local schools to waive tuition fees and created after-school learning centers staffed by volunteers. Beyond academic support, it also included trauma-informed care and recreational activities to promote emotional healing and stability among the children.

projects.title: Mobile Medical Aid Van
projects.description: In many tribal regions of Odisha, healthcare access is almost nonexistent. This project is funding the acquisition and operation of a mobile medical van equipped with basic diagnostics, vaccinations, and emergency care supplies. The van is staffed with a doctor, nurse, and local translator, and visits villages on a rotating schedule. Health education campaigns on maternal care, hygiene, and disease prevention are also run alongside medical services. The van has become a lifeline for thousands of isolated families.

projects.title: Rebuild Flooded School
projects.description: After severe flooding in Sofala, an elementary school serving 300 children was completely destroyed. This reconstruction project focuses on rebuilding climate-resilient classrooms, latrines, and a secure perimeter. New facilities are being elevated above flood lines and constructed with reinforced materials. Teachers and students will also receive disaster preparedness training. The new structure aims not only to restore education but also to act as a community shelter during emergencies.

projects.title: Rural Child Nutrition Program
projects.description: Malnutrition remains a pressing issue in Samar, where food insecurity is widespread among children. This project delivers daily hot meals and provides nutrition education to parents and caregivers. In collaboration with local health centers, children are also monitored for growth and deficiencies. The initiative trains mothers in preparing low-cost, high-nutrient meals using local ingredients. The results have already shown improved attendance in schools and healthier growth metrics among participants.

projects.title: Provide School Supplies
projects.description: In the conflict-affected province of North Kivu, many children attend school without proper materials. This project distributed over 300 backpacks, notebooks, and uniforms to students from low-income families. Special priority was given to internally displaced children and orphans. Teachers also received basic classroom supplies. The initiative aimed to restore a sense of dignity and belonging, improve school attendance, and encourage academic achievement in an otherwise challenging environment.

projects.title: Train Community Health Workers
projects.description: With limited healthcare infrastructure, South Sudan urgently needs grassroots health solutions. This project identifies 15 dedicated individuals from various communities and trains them in basic first aid, maternal health, sanitation, and epidemic awareness. These community health workers are equipped with medical kits and educational materials and serve as a vital link between remote villages and local clinics. Their presence ensures timely interventions and promotes health education at the household level.
